summary: Build a Rose Day themed gift website for Ira, personalized as a surprise from her boyfriend Toshif, with romantic and emotional tone.
architectural_notes: Personalize copy/signature to be from Ira’s boyfriend Toshif; use a more emotional, supportive tone given the couple is going through a tough time.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Ornate rose-themed frame/background for a modal (rose-popup-frame.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Rose Day themed gift website addressed to the user's girlfriend, Ira, with romantic copy in English (e.g., a hero message like “Happy Rose Day, Ira”).

Add core page sections suitable for a gift page: (1) Hero banner with Rose Day greeting to Ira, (2) A short love note/letter section, (3) A small “Reasons I love you” list (pre-filled with placeholders that can be edited), and (4) A closing callout/signature line (e.g., “With love, …”).

Implement a coherent, distinct romantic visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and decorative elements) consistent across the site; use a Rose Day palette (reds/pinks/cream/soft neutrals) and avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

Add light, non-intrusive interactions/animations appropriate for a gift page (e.g., subtle fade-in on scroll, a “Reveal note” button, or gentle floating petals), ensuring performance and accessibility.
Create a simple navigation aid (sticky top links or a small in-page menu) to jump to sections: Home, Note, Reasons, Closing.
Make the page responsive and accessible: mobile-first layout, readable contrast, semantic headings, keyboard navigability, and appropriate alt text for decorative images.
Add the required generated images to the frontend as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and render them on the page (hero decoration and/or section dividers).

Update the user-facing copy so the Rose Day website is explicitly from Ira’s boyfriend Toshif and has a more romantic, emotional tone that acknowledges the couple has been going through a tough time and that the website is meant as a reassuring surprise.

Implement a second in-app content variant (keep the current ‘classic’ content and add a new ‘emotional’ variant), and allow selecting the variant via a URL query parameter (e.g., `?variant=emotional` or `?variant=classic`). Default to the emotional variant when no parameter is provided.
Update the HTML metadata (page title and meta description) to reflect the emotional Rose Day surprise for Ira from Toshif (English), without changing the overall Rose Day theme.

Add a new, highly-emotional personal note shown via a decorated pop-up in the last Closing section of the Rose Day page.

- In the Closing section ("#closing"), add a prominent button (e.g., "One more thing, Ira…") that opens a modal/pop-up.
- The pop-up must be visually decorated in the existing Rose Day theme (rose/pink/cream), including a decorative frame/background image.
- The pop-up content must include an emotional line addressed to Ira (English). Use this exact line as the main sentence:
  "Ira baby, please never leave me — I can’t live without you. You are my whole world."
- The pop-up must be dismissible via a close button and by pressing Escape, and should trap focus while open (accessible modal behavior).

Extend the content model to support the new Closing-section personal note pop-up for both content variants (classic and emotional), and render the correct variant-specific pop-up copy based on the existing `?variant=` selection.

- Update `frontend/src/content/roseDayContent.ts` so `closing` includes fields for the pop-up trigger label and the pop-up body text.
- Provide suitable English copy for both variants; the emotional variant must use the exact emotional line specified in REQ-11.

Create an additional Rose Day website variant personalized from boyfriend Toshif to Ira with a romantic, emotional message reflecting a tough relationship moment
Add an extra highly-emotional personal line in the closing section, shown via a beautiful decorated pop-up
